Explanation: The bug in the buggy code is that it sorts the input values before checking for 13. This means that if 13 is not the smallest number, it will not be correctly identified and the numbers to its right will be included in the sum. Generated Test cases 1-14 should pass the buggy code because 13 is either not present or is the smallest number. Test cases 15-20 should fail the buggy code because 13 is not the smallest number. In the second generation of test cases, I have modified test cases 2, 3, 6, 9, 12, 13, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, and 20 to ensure that the buggy code passes the correct fraction of test cases.
